instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b green light pulsing and not powering up
threads.message: i have problem here. water damaged <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b with i replace all components with was water damaged and clean main board but is not powering up. green light on charger pulsing . any idea. i know there must be some short but how do i find what is doing it? I know there is few people who had this problem. can anybody help pls?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b green light pulsing and not powering up
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b green light pulsing and not powering up
threads.message:
ok voltage:
3v42= 3.44
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 12.62v
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>= 3.3v

i left board diconnected for we while and connect it again and powered up. and i reconected and connect again and is dead now. must be some capacitor  faulty
i dont know :(

threads.message: when battery is connected is showing red light so is charging

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b green light pulsing and not powering up
threads.message: Crap under SMC or around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> I bet.
